review: WOOOOOOOOOOOOOO!!!!!!!! Just picked up a to-go order, 2 for $22 special - we got the black bean veggie burger with the cajun shrimp alfredo pasta and the chefs prepared it perfectly!! Great atmosphere in the restaurant too, real family vibes.. They were even playing Flash Light by Parliament-Funkadelic - 10/10 service...The water cups were even top quality, not just rotted tap water with ice lol (First online review I've ever written in my life - honestly too many people are so quick to leave reviews when things go wrong, but when everything is just right it goes unacknowledged most of the time... so shout out to inglewood chilis!) good vibes - boyfriend

Left the Inglewood Chilis WITHOUT eating at around 630pm yesterday. We initially were waiting for a regular table for 4 (30-45 min wait, that's fine) but saw an open seat after 20 min in the bar. So my  group and I stood next to the table thinking it would be cleaned off soon, I even asked the host... 2 more more tables opened up in the bar more guest stood by those. STILL NO ONE came to clean them. On group left after 15 min. I went to the host stand twice, they said they would call someone over. The manager Kenneth who I saw multiple times during our wait walking around aimlessly finally came over and cleaned ONE table in 3 trips VERY slowly. Seriously I've worked in restaurants, I can understand when it's busy however when a manager doesn't move to the current pace of the restaurant then it's a hindrance to the process of serving the customer and a burden to their staff.  Whether they were understaffed or under prepared for the concert down the street as a manager Kenneth needed to hustle better, be helpful to his staff, observant, and be more apologetic to waiting guest.  GO to the Red Lobster next door, the service and food were great.
-Horrible service. -Waitress would disappear for 15 min at a time. -My food arrived cold. -I will never eat there again. -The worst dining experience I have ever had.
Ordered through Postmates...took about an hour and a half to get it, but the food itself made the wait worth it. Love the enchilada soup!

Bathroom in this place is gross!! Our server was amazing but the place is just the worst chilies I've ever been to. Something needs to change. It's super loud and the ambiance is just rowdy. Do not bring your kids here cause there are a ton of bad word being said all over the restaurant. I feel bad for the kids. Hands down the worst!!!
Ghetto. Everything. Everyone. Ghetto Agree with the other ratings. 0 service. No f's given by staff here. Typical of LA anyway.

The waiter was wonderful. He gave great service and he made sure we had anything in a timely manner. My only complaint is the chicken on my fajita platter had a weird taste to it. Also there was not enough meat on the platter. The steak and shrimp portion taste was great but the chicken wasn't great at all. Also their drinks (alcohol) were good as well.

The food is not the highest quality.  Hence the 3 stars. I just feel it's a 3 Star meal. It definitely not a 5 Star. It's one of the better chilies  I've been to due to the service I received from Heckter. You can tell he cares about doing a good job and I appreciate it.

location: South Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA
review: I love chili's but this location is very bad, very bad customer service. As I arrived the person that seats you was having a conversation with another employee as we waited for her to be done and then sat us. As I received my order we received the wrong order and had to wait for it, we received it and waited for another order we had done and the lady had forgotten about it so we had to ask for it again as we almost finished our meals. We were also so mad because we needed an extra fork that we asked for and never got it, luckily we found a fork our selves. Please don't go their and consider looking for another location!!! I repeat do not go their and I feel bad for the chef because the food is so good but the service is simply awful.

It's been awhile since we gave this location a third chance.  But thanks to our server  (Azi) she was great our food was right but the attention she gave us has no words.  Thanks for the great service and let's not forget even though it was full we did not have to wait for long from the welcome in the front door up until we got the bill.  Did not mind paying for great service. Thanks .

This review is for the night of 6/24/2017 Came to chilis last night and the service was horrible, we came during happy hour and the waitress we had was terrible.  She took 30 minutes to bring us our first drinks, 15 minutes to bring additional ranch for our Texas cheese fries and left off a couple of things from the main entree I ordered, which were the fajitas.  The food was excellent, however, she forgot to put the white queso on the fajitas as I requested although it was showing up on my ordering kiosk.  She seemed out of place and was not very attentive to her area as she was often seen dawdling in the kitchen conversing with other staff.  The manager we spoke to ironed things out for us so he relieved some of the bad service that we did experience that night.
Can't pass up$5 Margaritas night. Good night to be out friends............Thank Chili's for a night full of fun and laughter!

This is my review for Sunday evening. The wait was long, about 30 mins. When we were finally seated it took a while before we got our drinks. When we received our food, we were missing a few items, I asked for a substitute and they forgot. The also forgot to the ranch and sour cream we ordered. She never came back to check on us to see if we needed refills. The food was decent. Overall, I won't be coming back ever again!
First we waited for 1 hour and then we sat our selfs at the bar...then they took forever.. they forgot our drinks and forgot part of our order...our food was cold, the ribs were dry...

Trashy mess.. what a mess and they know it. GM -down, none of them care or even try to step it up. Manager on duty usually hides from confrontation. Sad thing is all the staff is black and so am I, so I ain't just saying it to say it. They need to do a full re-hire from the ground up. They had tables dirty for over thirty minutes. Host said you stand by a dirty table the waitress will clean it... what a joke!!! A hot Mess.. if it's so dirty in the lobby I can only guess how the kitchen looks

We went to this Chili's location because we did not feel like driving a long distance, and we were pleasantly surprised to find such abundant parking. We decided to sit at the bar rather than a table so that we would get better service and watch games more easily on the multiple TVs behind and surrounding the bar. My guy ordered a tall Angel City IPA, and I had Jalepeno Margarita, both of which paired well with the Three Combination Meats that we shared.  For the meats, we chose the Craft Beer BBQ Ribs, BBQ Chicken, and Spicy BBQ Sausage.  The meal came with fries, street corn, and pickles. The food tasted good, and the bartender served us pretty quickly. For  $38.80 (before tip), we thought that it was a pretty good deal.

My sister, niece and I came here on Thursday (9-22-16). When we first arrived it was packed!!!! So there was a wait of 20 minutes. The host was very friendly and nice. So my family and I decided to go for walk until they text us that our table is ready. About 15 minutes they text us our table is ready and we report to Chilis. Upon entering we were promptly seated and they provided us a booster seat for my 2 year old niece. My sister was worried that Chilis did not accommodate little ones and I reassured her that they do! They gave my niece a little play book to color in but if you know 2 year old niece everything was in pieces before we ordered our drinks and the crayon was no where to be found! Sorry Chilis! Gotta love kids. My sister and I ordered our food and didn't know my nieces play book was a menu too! And so we ordered her food. But she didn't like her meal she had Mac and cheese along with French Fries. She loved the French Fries! I tried the Mac and cheese and it wasn't too bad. She is just too picky! So our meals arrives about 5 min after hers and we chow down. I had a chipotle chicken bowl and my sister had the Rib burrito so yummy! The food was amazing. My niece was having a good time and playing with the staff members by giving them high 5s as they walked which drew attention from other patrons who thought that it was too cute and wanted a high 5 from her too! Overall my sister, niece and I really enjoyed our time at Chilis. My first time dining at this chain and it was nice to see a dominance of color for once! Also when we left there was live entertainment outside! Can't get better than that!

I ordered soup and when it came out it was lukewarm I asked that they heat it more....so when they bring it back out it's so hot it burned my mouth.....I asked to see the manger and they tell me the manager name a female but they send this guy from the kitchen and he says he the manager with a cook apron on...he go on to say he placed it in the microwave for 30 seconds.....I let him know that the soup has been sitting on the table for almost 10 minutes and it's still to hot to eat......he asked if I wanted anything else but by this time I'm not feeling to good about them possibly doing something to my food before it comes out so I say no I'm good.......the service here is always bad......

I've always been a TGI Friday person and not so much Chilly's not because of the food but the service no matter which location including this sucked! Just keep it real, we I had a gift card in my wallet from Chilly's and I was both hungry and try too save some money so know all this and knowing they have a HALLY HOUR! Give it another try.  I was pleasantly surprised not be because the service in the restaurant but of Crystal, the young lady that was taking the to go order's.  I told her what I said here on Yelp and her response "well hopefully I can change your mind and that she did. She was attentive professional and explain to me and answer all my questions in the menu and what I was still kind of confused she gave a suggestion which was the Cajun pasta take care of it for me even got me a glass of water when I was waiting.  There was gentleman before that came back because his order was no right and she toqok care of that real quick fast and hurry also apologize for the inconvenience. It doesn't sound like much  but Crystal's customer service was very much appreciated​.  So much so that I let the manager know.  So does it sound like I'll be back? What do you think..And when I di, who do you think I will ask for.. Crystal

This restaurant being rated 2 stars is generous. Food was burnt black, and writing this review while my girlfriend and I fight over the toilet. Have fun dying from dehydration waiting on your waiter to bring you water, and if that doesn't do you in the garden hose out your a** will. I highly encourage yelp to create a no star rating specifically for this place.

HORRIBLE service and staff, from management to the servers. My friend and i came in on a Wednesday night . They closed at 11pm we got there at 10:40pm and we waited in the lobby until 11:15pm until anyone even acknowledged us . I have never had worse customer service. I went the night of 8/28/16 and was treated as if I was a random person on the street. initially, I wasn't greeted when I walked in and when I finally received a greeter's attention and asked if a section was open, he directed me to ask another waiter. I walked out of the restaurant after a waiter motioned to me to move out the way because I was blocking the bar and said I needed to move rudely and I had to ask for a wash cloth to clean my own table. The manager did not know how to correct the customer service issues and his staff after one of his staff members cursed him out.  I would never recommend anyone to go to this location. I will never go back!

Went to chilis on Wednesday for my big sisters birthday. It's sad cause we go there pretty often and that day was special and we had the worse experience. it was extremely messy and the customer service was horrible very bad attitudes half of the restaurant  waa shut down and  very disappointed WITH my local chilis
I love Chilis. However they have been really laxed in the service dept. My food was cold, my drinks ice had melted in it, because it sat so long. Management sicks here!

I was going to say this was the WORST chilis I'd been too but it's actually the worst restaurant period!! We get there and the line to be seated is extra long. I go to the restroom and see at least 5 tables open. But I thought to myself "ok maybe they aren't seating people because they're short on staff" . Well I get to the restroom and it's a pigsty!!!! Paper all over the floor, the floors are wet and since they're so dirty it looks like it's filled with mud!! Then we finally get seated 30 minutes later, it's about 15-20 minutes after that before someone asks if we've had a server come to us. We order our food and it arrives 40 minutes later. Then to top it all off our waitress comes to "check" how everything is AT THE END of our meal once we were already done. WILL NOT BE RETURNING. CORPORATE SHOULD PAY THEM A VISIT!!

The staff is not customer focused at all. They were highly unprofessional as I sit near the kitchen hearing them curse back and forth at each other. They were threatening each other because of a heated discussion. There was a man eating food off the plate in the kitchen. This was right before closing so I understood that they might be tired. Guest got angry and were making a scene. No one came to help. Just let customers gather at the door angry. The other night I felt like I was watching Punk'D as I sat and watched this Chilli staff.

Where to begin? My girlfriend and I took my parents to this Chili's for my mother's birthday. First our waitress seemed confused on how to place orders on the handheld device. Once we had placed our orders (we had to remind her of who still had not ordered). First we were told that they had run out of the ingredients for virgin margaritas, then we had to wait an obscene amount of time before our food came which wouldn't have been noticeable if not for the fact that all of the tables around us who were seated after us had received their food before us. Then once the food had arrived, it was either overcooked or undercooked (it should be hard to mess up quesadillas but here we are) My mother had to send back her plate because of the burnt rice and to make matters worse, we asked for the staff to sing happy birthday to my mother and after they sang to every other birthday in the restaurant, I had to remind them to sing for my mother too. I can't say in stronger terms than this, stay away from this Chili's.

Many improvements, deserving of more than the current star rating. Everything was great; the service, the food, the servers, the ambient. It does get pretty busy, which is the only reason someone would not give it a high rating;  but that's the clients' fault for being impatient and expecting to be seated when it's most busy on a Friday and Saturday or holiday weekend. But if you don't mind the wait, it's worth it.
The wait 10 min.. to be helped.... over 30 min waiting and no waiter would even glance at us to service us stay away from place

Took my family to chillis last night and was less than impressed.  This is a national chain and the expectations should be similar but this location is sadly lacking.  The hostess walks around frowning, leaves you waiting for a seat in a half empty restaurant while she sweeps. Once seated the benches are torn and look like a spring is about to bust through when you sit down. Now the reason for at least 3 stars was our server, I believe her name was Jackie. She took our order and got it right she took great care of the girls and remained attentive. Hats off to her! !!  So Chill's get it together and fix this location to fit the service.  If it looks like a dump it will be treated as one.

The worst Chillis I've ever been to, it's worth driving to the next closest one in Torrance. Me and my husband walked in around 9:10PM and sat in the bar area, 25 minutes later the waitress came up to us and asked us what we would like to drink, we put in our order for food and drinks. 30 minutes later at 9:55pm no drinks no food! I was so frustrated seeing that everyone around us had there food and drinks. It's no surprise they have 2 stars, my fault for not checking the yelp review before I stepped in to this horrible place. The management needs to be upgraded. This place could potentially have 5 stars, but with this management and these employees that have no regards for there clientele. Stay away from this place, not worth it. I'd recommend you go to Fiesta Martin right down the street, great margaritas, awesome service and amazing Mexican food.

Came on a Friday evening. Place was packed due to concert at Forum. I did the waitlist thru Yelp so we waited less than 10 mins to be seated as opposed to the 25 min wait. Our server was Tanisha and she was super attentive and sweet. She checked up on us several times but was not annoying about it. Food was good, what I would expect from any Chili's. Overall, hubby and I had a good experience and we will probably be back.

Filthy, stay away, unless they start to clean this place up!!! Get it together Chili's or get the heck out of the community!! Took moms here for her bday today and now I'm scared for life! I called over 10 times and no one ever answered and yes I called the correct number because I confirmed by checking google, yelp, and the company's website. I'd most likely never order take out from here again because of this experience and would rather travel a little further to a restaurant with better service than this. We said we'd never go back and look I just pop in and it just cemented my decision smh. I'll be emailing corporate asap.

I used to like Chilis. But, the service here is lacking. It seems they are consistently understaffed and cannot handle the volume of people they allow into their restaurant. Twenty-five minutes to get something to drink- and then an hour after our order was placed, we had to cut our losses and leave. Three times we were told they would "check" on our order. No answer. Everyone around us that was seated AFTER us received their food. It seemed as if there was an error made with our order, yet nobody informed us if why there was such a delay.  Like I said, I used to like Chilis. But I will not be going back.

Why didn't I consider checking reviews prior to visiting? ‍ At her choice, I treated my grandmother to a late mothers day lunch at Chilis. I understand its not going to be parallel to the service if a five course white tablecloth restaurant but, professionalism at least?  Upon entering, my grandmother and I were greeted with "we dont have no seats right now you can sit anywhere at the bar"  No option to wait, no "HELLO" or "WELCOME", nothing. Luckily we found a booth in the bar area as I dont want my 85 year old grandmother on a barstool. After more than 10 minutes we were finally greeted by a waiter who wanted to take our drink order. Nice try sir, we wont see you again for a while so you're taking our food order as well.  We politely asked for ice for my grandmothers iced tea, did we ever get it? Nope. We just gave up and ordered another. We were here about 4pm. The bar area was not crowded at all and majority of the parties there when we arrived had already had their meal so it wasnt as if we had to wait for multiple tables to receive their orders first.  There was no sense of urgency or care to the customers there. We had to ask for items that should have already been available like,silverware, napkins, etc.  Granny and I agreed that was our last time visiting.

Best by far and none to go are easy , food is always really fresh and service is always good

The service here sucks with the exception of Ronnie the lady hostess. The guy who took my order had an attitude as well as the young lady that brought out our food. The manager was a smart ass too. I won't be back.

Went into the restaurant around 8:00pm on Monday 12/18/2017 It took 15 minutes to be seated near the bar area. I had to find my own table and when i found it I asked three servers to clean the table none of them did so. It took for me to ask for a Manager (who didn't come by until 45minutes after me asking for him) The bar area and surrounding area was filled with dirty plates, dirty glasses and several serves and bartenders playing "basketball" with napkins I made a comment to the server about the dirty glasses by the bar and she said "there's a sink behind there thats why the glasses are there" i then repeat the same comment to the manager his response was " I've been in the business for over 20years trash will get on the floor) The overall experience was the worst and it wasn't busy in the store at all.

My experience at Chili's, Inglewood on Century Blvd. on Saturday, October 14, 2017.  I called in an order for pickup, which was the Cajun Chicken Pasta. I drove to the restaurant and picked it up and when I got home, I started eating and noticed that the chicken was NOT cooked all the way. I was not about to eat raw poultry, so I immediately called and the woman who answered (did not get her name, but she sounded like the woman who rang me up, when picked my food up) and I explained to her that my chicken was not fully cooked. She asked me if I wanted to drive back to the restaurant and exchange the pasta for something else. I told her that I'm not driving all the way back over there and I asked her to please just refund my card. She then asked if I wanted to come back tomorrow and get something different and I again said no, and to please refund my card. She said that she'd have to have her manager, Will do the refund, but she'll make sure he does it right now and we then got off of the phone. I called back about 20 minuets later, just to make sure they already refunded my card and when I called, a woman answered by the name of Lakisha and I told her that I was calling to make sure my card has already been refunded and she said told me to hold on, then slammed the phone down and hung up on me. I called back again and a different person answered the phone and I told them the situation with the raw chicken and that I was calling to make sure Will refunded my card already. She then put me on hold and said she'd go ask Will. She came back to the phone and said that Will told her that he was waiting to speak with me on the phone, so he could get my card number, but said he's on his way to pick up the phone now and to hold for a couple of minutes. Will finally came to the phone and was super dry and didn't introduce himself, so I asked if I was speaking with Will and he said "yes, who's this?" I told him who I was and that I was told that he was waiting to speak with me, so he could refund my card. He said he didn't know what I was talking about and that his staff just told him that someone was on the phone for him, so he came to the phone and he knew nothing about my situation. I did not believe his story, but I proceeded to explain to him what happened with my food and that I wanted to be refunded. He NEVER apologized once, but instead, started defending his cooks and saying that they are very properly trained and they would never under cook chicken and so on. I told him that it sounds like he's implying that I'm not telling the truth, because he never apologized for my inconvenience, but instead defended his cooks. He then said that he's not implying anything, but he can't say that what I'm telling him really happened, because he never saw the meat himself. I told him, that statement right there implies that he's calling me a liar and that I don't appreciate, as a CUSTOMER, being insulted! He said that his staff always opens the to go box, to let the customer see the food, before they leave and he asked me if that happened and I told him that it had not. But, even if they did open the box to show it to me, it was the inside of the chicken that was not cooked all the way, so I wouldn't have been able to tell, just by glancing at the chicken on top of some pasta, if the middle had been cooked all the way through. I told him that I don't have time to call in an order, take my time and use my gas, to drive to the restaurant, pay for the food, then drive back home, just to call them and make up some story, for $15! I told him that I'd be making a complaint against him, because this is not how you treat customers and that he needs SERIOUS training in customer service. I told him that I wanted his information and he said that his name was Will and that's all I need to know. I asked what his managers name was and he said, Nico. I  advised that I'd be calling Nico about my horrible, insulting service that I received from him.  I called Chili's, the next day and Nico answered the phone. I explained the situation to her. She just listened and then said she'll have a conversation with Will about how they could have handled the situation better and she asked me if Will asked me to bring the food back and I told her, no and even if he had asked me to, I wasn't about to drive all the way back over there again to return the food to them and further inconvenience myself. Nico did not make me feel any better about the ordeal and what I went through. She was very dry and seemed very unfazed about the way Will treated me. It pretty much felt like she just wanted the call to be over and she sounded very fake in her apology. Will really made me feel extremely insulted. I am a very high integrity person, so to make me feel like I'm being deceptive and totally insulting me, about THEIR restaurant undercooking my poultry, is a horrible feeling.

Awful service!!!!!! Came on Saturday night, the hostess kept on sending everyone to the bar area, which didn't even have a single open space to seat!!!  After we got seated, I had to actually get someone's attention to order drinks, at least, because after fifteen minutes NO ONE had come to even get the drink order!  After we finally ordered drinks and two appetizers, another twenty minutes passed by with no drinks, nor appetizers.  We finally got up and left the place!!!! Never coming back to this location!!! I will never eat or drink anything from this Chillis again. After speaking with a manager she informed me that she could not move forward in unless I brought the cup in so she could look at it her self. The bar tenders really make good drinks.  Beer from the draft is served in a cold frosty mug. Love the little thing. Very causal and comfortable. location: West Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA
review: Came here for a late lunch last Sunday. It was pouring outside so I figured it would be empty. Boy was I wrong! The waiting area was packed & so was the bar. Luckily I spotted a table & we were in the game, literally! The Patriots were playing, that's really why my bf wanted to come, I came for the food. Lol! We quickly ordered our food & drinks & we waited... we waited some more & finally our drinks came. The long wait is what made them lose a star. I understand it was a busy period, but the least they can do is get our drinks out fast. This way we're more likely to keep drinking. You would think right... not here. We finally got our food, I ordered this new tray. Two meats for $15.99, plus $2 if one of the meats you choose is ribs. I of course ordered the ribs. The chicken crispers were delicious, the sweet chili sauce is the best! My ribs, not so much. The whole platter (minus the chicken) had this chili powder sprinkled on it. My corn, my garlic bread, the ribs! Eeeek! The chili powder is overkill. Made the food extra salty. I probably wouldn't have this tray again, but the chicken crispers are my bf & my favorite.

Too many chiefs, not enough Indians here. We get here and we were told that it would be a 15-20 minute wait but we ended up waiting for an hour and 5 minutes. I checked in periodically see what the hold up was about but every time I checked in there was a new person. They each kept apologizing and saying "it'll be a few more minutes." My one year one was getting fussier and fussier and as a parent you know what a fussy baby does to nerves. Just a recommendation, the place needs one voice that echoes to the employees. Not every employee running their own programs. My visit was almost not worth it especially with the choices of places to eat that surrounds it.

Sunday night my wife and I decided on Chili's Ingelwood and we couldn't have made worse decision. We arrived at 5:15 p.m., as we entered there were two small parties seated in the waiting area, my wife asked the hostess what the wait time was and the hostess responded thirty minutes for the dinning area, she placed our name and then told myself of the wait time. We were both a little confused as we could see eight open tables within eyesight and several employees about, we decided to wait. After 10 minutes or so I noticed two open tables in the bar area and suggested we take a table as we could have a drink and either eat there or when our table in the main dinning area was ready we could move. As we entered the bar area to claim a table we noticed both tables had the previous parties dishes still on each table, not a problem we would take a table and wait for it to be cleaned and order a drink. We noticed right away there appeared to be one employee working behind the bar and one employee working the tables. We sat at the table for roughly twenty minutes and watched the waiterss working tables all around us, never once a word or even eye contact to acknowledge us. At this point my wife and I began to wonder if we were going to receive service let alone the table cleared. After serval more minutes we noticed the couple that was seated next to us stand up and the male said "that's it we are out of hear" that was when I realized they had been seated at their table prior to our arrival and their table had not been cleaned from the previous party as well or the waitress acknowledge them, they walked out. After another ten minutes and 0 (zero) customer service I asked my wife if our name was still on the waiting list, she said yes and we should be paged soon as it was at least thirty minutes sense she put us on the list, we decided to go back to the waiting area. The waiting area had filled up from when we had originally entered. The two couples that were in the waiting when we first entered were now standing at the reception desk looking rather irritated so my wife asked one of the parties if they were still waiting and he replied "Yes, but we are leaving as they had been waiting almost an hour" they did leave and shortly after the other party walked out as well. My wife went to the hostess and asked for an update on our wait and again she was told thirty minutes, my wife told the hostess we have told thirty minutes when we first put our name in, the hostess responded we our changing shift's and it will be thirty minutes. We decide to wait a little longer but after another twenty minutes my wife asked to speak to the manager. We are not sure if the employee ever told the manager of our request to speak with them as they never came out to speak with us. While we were waiting for the manager we watched several additional parties that had been waiting walk out. After another fifteen minutes waiting for the no show manager and we walked out as well. I can't tell you how their food was or even how their customer service was as the only thing we got from the staff after an hour in their establishment was "thirty minutes".   I do have one additional regret, as we were walking away I looked back into the bar window and over one hour from the time we entered Chili's that bar table still had the dirty dishes stacked on it. I regret not taking a picture of that table and posting it here. Don't waste your time...  I have never called a corporate office to complain but after the holiday I will be calling Chili's, hope the upper management responds a little quicker then their on site no show management.

Despite the reviews here on Yelp, I truly, really wanted to give this place a second chance, because when it first opened a few years back, it truly was a great establishment in Inglewood. Sadly, to report that the place once again failed to live up to any glimmer of hope. We went on a cold/rainy Spring evening, and were assigned to our waiter, "Mark Za". I don't know if he's new, but he certainly is far too shy to be a waiter. When we asked what he'd recommend, it was more or less us going through the menu and getting a nod from him 'yay or nay'. On top of that, table service was rather atrocious -- Mark only came around, 4 times total (including the time he came around to take our food/drink order). I mentioned it was a cold/rainy evening because the restaurant seemed to be running at about 40% capacity-- So it wasn't full nor was it busy. For appetizers, we had the Chicken Nachos, Tableside Guac, and the standard "salsa/chips". Let me tell you, the best part was the Chicken Nachos. They were fresh, great tasting and the only thing to come out that kitchen that wasn't BURNED! The Tableside Guac was really bland. They bring you the guac on a plastic 'molcajete' and they do the Guac on the spot at your table. They need to add cilantro and certainly garlic salt. Without those two ingredients, Guac simply does not attain the taste everyone familiar with authentic Mexican Guac. That Guac stayed untouched by our party of four. For our main course, we ordered a Trio Mix/Match Fajitas (Steak/Chicken/Shrimp) and paid extra for the special rice/beans that was an optional add on, the Fresh Mix Pairing Trio (2 soft tacos/1 enchilada), Grilled Chicken Salad, and the Chipotle Fresh Mex Bowl with Grilled Chicken. (These are all pictured in the attached pics below.) It took us 25 minutes to get the Margaritas we ordered when we first sat down (Someone from the bar brought them over). It's saying a lot (about how slow service is) when we were all done with our lemonades before our appetizers came out. The appetizers I've already gone into detail previously, with the Chicken Nachos and salsa/chips being the highlight.  About 15 minutes after we got the appetizers, our waiter, Mark, was walking about when he looked over at me and realized we still didn't have our main course then signaled at me as though to say "I got you". 10 minutes after that, he came out with our plates. I should have known something was wrong when my Mix/Match Fajitas Trio was giving off a burned smell. You know when you over-cook something at home you can tell the difference between it being fully cooked and burned? Yeah, that's the smell that was coming from the Fajitas. Sure enough, it was so burned, that all the onions and bell peppers were stuck to the bottom of the cast iron plate they serve it in. Not only that, but the beef was very rubbery, which lets you know this isn't fresh meat, but rather par-cooked beef that is highly processed before it's served at your table. The picture of the shrimp on the menu showed medium-sized shrimp, the shrimp on the plate, as you can tell from the picture below, are small shrimp-- Certainly not what I thought I was getting when I ordered the dish. I left the plate alone after only eating the chicken, which is the only thing that didn't appear burned. I had to fetch Mark over and remind him that I paid extra for the rice and beans, to which he looked puzzled and instead of saying he would bring it right out, he said he would credit me for it on the bill-- If I ordered it, I want to at least taste it, not ordering for you to tell me what I can or can't consume.  I like how you can order other stuff from the little machines on each table-- I went ahead and ordered myself an appetizer of Smoked Wings (pictured). I don't know why I even bothered. Fool me once, shame on you, Fool me twice, shame on me. After I ordered the Smoked Wings, 20 minutes later, Mark came by the table to let me know that my order would be delayed because (these were his exact words): "The cook burned your wings, so the kitchen manager is in there re-doing your order of wings". Everyone in our table laughed hard, and all Mark could do was apologize for the delay. The wings finally came out and were good, but undercooked (as you can tell from the picture I uploaded - Wings should never be light yellow, especially not smoked wings.) I don't know what they put in the Pico de Gallo but it certainly wasn't your run-of-the-mill 'mild' PDG. It was extremely spicy, and we had to return the Grilled Chicken Salad due to the salad being flooded with pico de gallo throughout the entire salad, making it not edible. The Fresh Mix Pairing Trio was good as the person who had it said it tasted good, but the extra tortillas we ordered for it came out COLD! We put those tortillas on the side and left them alone. All in all, I have to give this place 2 stars. It just isn't what it once was. I won't be returning.

Nice color photos and promo menus for the NEW Craft burgers (which look very yummy), but there is NO indication as to their SIZE (quarter, third or half pound??).  Why?  That is a very important fact and even the servers are clueless, as that info has not been passed along to them. Same goes for the steaks:  the sirloin says it is CHOICE grade but the Ribeye listed next to it has no mention of the meat grade.  Is it also CHOICE or SELECT.  The customers want to know this simple info.  Servers have no idea either and don't know that meat even comes in 3 major grades:  Select (the nasty stuff you get at most grocery stores), Choice which is a middle grade and O.K., and PRIME, which is what you usually get at higher end steak houses like Flemings, Morton's and Ruth's Chris.

This place has the worst customer service Ever. I have never been treated so poorly in my life. I would never ever come back here ever. Save yourself money and time and stay far away from this place. If I could give a zero rating I would.

I wish there was a no-star rating. At around 7pm, my boyfriend and I were shopping in the Best Buy in the parking lot of this Chili's. We decided that was going to be our dinner so I called when we started shopping. It rang about 7 times, asked if I wanted to be transfered to the host. It then rang another 7 times, same message. I hung up, tried again. Same thing. I wasn't really paying attention to how many times I called because we were shopping. Finally, 15 minutes and 12 phone calls later, I realize it and get pissed. My boyfriend starts calling. 5 minutes later he finally gets someone and he hands me the phone. I had no idea if I was on the To-Go line or the host line, so I said "Hi, I've been trying to call to place a to-go order?" The guy on the other end, very snarkily replied "Yeah, and?" I was caught of guard and asked if I was on the to-go line or not. His reply? "Uh, yeah. Why do you think I'm asking? What do you want?" Needless to say, 50 minutes, 20 of them being a ringtone, for wrong and pitiful food is not a good way to get customers to come back. Bye bye Downey Chili's.

Can I give this place a zero!!! We were there on a Thursday evening and walked out after waiting for over an hour for our food!!! Went on a Sunday at 2pm with a group of SIXTEEN people and our server Kwame was excellent. It is very hard to manage such a large group and he did a great job. Very good and attentive. Had a good time, no waiting, and the service was good. I was very pleased, since one time we waited over 2 hours to be seen.

We waited about 10 min before our server to come to our table. I like the ribs and margaritas. The servers are ok when they actually show up.  We happen to have got a server in training, maybe that explains the long wait. In the past they have been quiet good.
Very good service here. I am very pleased with the food and drinks. (love the mango margarita) Happy hour is the best!  Next time im in Inglewood I will definitely be coming back here.

Tonight everyone was baby-backed. Chili's is quite an experience, and I'm not just blowing hot air. The spices permeate the heavily conditioned air and even upon my first step in this glorious establishment I knew destiny had been pulling me in this direction all my life. Sports blasting from televisions that cover every surface, servers and bartenders with their cheshire cat smiles, strawberry-cran-oritas, fried potato-mayo-cheese-bacon-mustard-salsa clusters, oh-so-southwestern tile tabletops. Businessmen taking a load off after a long day crunching numbers and spanking secretaries. Parents taking their translucent children to a well-earned dinner after soccer practice. A rotund couple nearly breaks their chairs as they shovel succulent meats into their gaping maws. It all comes together like a cosmic jigsaw puzzle to create this culinary colossus. Chili's, it's the place for me.
The service here usually sucks! We got the food before utensils . The bacon cheddar chicken that I ordered without mushrooms came without any of the three. Not even the blackberry margarita was good.

Not only was the service extremely slow but when we got our bill the 18% gratuity was added to our bill on a party of 4. The whole time we were seated in the back we could see the manager just standing in the back watching the tables instead of walking around to check how the customers were being treated.  The only waiter who treated us well and recommended us a good drink at the end was Daniel!
It's not so bad if you use Chili's To-Go. Chili's To-Go seems to be faster than going inside. (duh)  Love the chicken crispers....

Location was okay. They took over 30 minutes to serve me half a sandwich and to make it even worse they gave me a lemonade with ice already melted. Waiter seemed rushed too. well thank you but this service sucked !

If you've been to one Chili's you've been to every Chili's. However, this one has one of the finest bartenders I've ever seen working the midday rails. I don't know what her name was but she looks ethnically mixed with everything and has a very nice voice and attitude. I might return just for that eye candy.

Intially I was displeased with this chili's when a made my first visit shortly after they opened. But after visiting time & time again its pretty good restaurant. Food is good, drinks are great. Perfectly priced, no complaints. This is one of my favorite spots.

Chili's is great for couples and/or families!  I can always find something I like on the menu and even fewer calorie choices for when I want to behave!!  With a family of 5 it's hard finding a place everyone agrees on & that won't break the bank!!  The food is always good and wait staff is always friendly & accommodating.  Thank you for being a favorite of ours!
Really good for an affordable price,we hardly waited to be seated which is great considering that I have 2 toddlers, overall excellent service waitress was really friendly!

hate this place! been here multiple times and its always the same shitty experience! the entire staff is hella rude. they always mess up my order, its always dirty, the wait is ridiculously long and not to mention the staff is hella rude. i will never be coming back to this place ever again!
The food was good, but waitress was very forgetful and this Chillies is kind of dirty. Will not be returning.

I have been to this restaurant several times for dinner and I have had very good experiences every time except once when there was a long wait because of several graduations going on. Otherwise, the service has been excellent and our waiters have been very cheerful and service oriented. The food is always tasty. Salads are great and so are the burgers. I recommend it.

I hate this Chili's!! The managers are so fake and are liars... The food was great as always at Chili's, but unfortunately, the service wasn't :-(. It took the waiter a long time to take our order, refill our drinks and bring the receipt. Moreover, he hardly looked at us when serving us...

I can understand the rating for this place. The service was slower than normal - not sure if due to busy, it was almost 3pm after all, or short staff or lack of attentive employees. I do know two women who appeared to be supervisors or managers took their lunch and were helped more than me, I was sitting across from them. 15 minutes to order, but the waitress who did wait on me seemed sincere in her apologies - so there's that.

Omg so irritated with this place.. My friends and I were hungry so we stopped here I ordered a steak with potatoes and broccoli and the steak was pricey and wasn't quality at all. We got our food after an hour and then we STILL didn't have any utensils. After 10 minutes went by I asked the manager to help us out with that. Our waiter didn't even check up on us to see if we needed anything either. Then it took Another 20 minutes to get the check. I was ready to explode lol. Won't be coming back to this chilis or any other chilis.

Where do I start? First, the bathroom was nasty and unstocked. After being seated, it took 15 min to get our drink order in and another 10 for them to come. We ordered our food and waited 30min. When the food came my husbands steak was very, very rare so he sent it back and I asked for a drink refill, they never came. I ate my full meal and we waited for 20 min before we gave up on waiting. We asked to get our check and the manager was rude and refused to take the meal off even though we never got it. This while time one person at the next table walked out and a woman at another table fell asleep after waiting so long. Should be zero stars.

Well what can I say... I've always been a fan of fine dining and chilis is an expert of making me feel like I'm living the fancy life while also wearing sweatpants.  Today, I thought I'd visit the chilis is Inglewood, CA. Before eating there I had heard that this chilis is the 3rd most popular chilis in America... yeah ok, we'll see about that.. So I walked in and as an experienced yelp reviewer I asked to see the manager right away to let him know that I am a food critic (on yelp) and that he better treat me nicely or he can expect a one star on yelp (I'm not afraid to ruin someone's business!!) Unfortunately, the employees said that the manager isn't available and has been hiding out in the back room for the whole day.. So naturally I decided to investigate... I entered the back room only to find the manager camping out in the back playing clash royale!!! He said that it was an urgent matter because the clan chest needed to filled up I then showed him my deck in clash royale and he gave me some great tips on how to improve my game The manager then said I can just eat my meal with him in the back room and we can play clash royale and of course I accepted. I ordered the Santa Fe chicken quesadillas which apparently aren't on the menu anymore but he said  he can make one anyway. (What a guy!) He let me join his clan called "That's cool" and it's a pretty good clan. If any of you decide to join my name in the clan is "Freshbubba" In conclusion, the food was OK
I love Chilis.  I always go to Chilis. Service here was great. Steven greeted us right away with waters, queso was out a few minutes later. Food came out quickly, drinks were on point.

location: South Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA
review: Our server was so amazing. The experience tonight was so wonderful. I will definitely be back. Love Chili's.

Okay. I mean,  its Chili's and it's the hood... The food is well,  Chili's. The service is well,  the hood. The atmosphere is well,  Inglewood. If you want a good time,  a cold drink,  and your palate is indiscriminate,  this just might be the spot! Old timers at the bar,  Pocahontas hanging out in front,  Ray Ray and them in the back, popo in the parking lot with a baseball bat. JK. It's Chili's yall. It's the hood yall. Don't expect too much and your feelings won't get hurt. Don't expect anything at all and you might mess around and have a ball.

This was my FIRST and LAST time eating at this Chili's. It took them 2 hours to get a to go order together after ordering my food ahead of time. The rice was hard as a brick. I understand that it was mother's day and they were backed up to the 405 fwy but they should have told us that the wait would take an extra 2 hours on top of the 2 that we were told. I had to give this dump 1 star in order to review this place.

Let me start with the good.....the waiter was nice.  However the few staff who are attentive and caring are easily overshadowed by the unruly majority of the clientele.   It is extremely loud in this bar section. The environment on this side is extremely disorganized and unbelievably harsh on the ears.  A busy day is understandable. The inability of the staff to address the issues: 1)  Unruly behavior, due to alcohol, being tolerated.  2) Absolute indifference to the rest of the clienteles level of overall satisfaction.   3) The visibility of the TV completely blocked due to the absurd number of people standing and yelling without any regard to the people around.  This is just unacceptable.  Your location currently holds a 2 1/2 star rating in Yelp. This rating, in my opinion, is beyond nice. It is maybe a rating of pity. Almost as if saying I hated my experience but I don't want you to close down, here's a star or two. Can't ignore the majority.  2 stars......out of pity.

So I eat here normally twice a week various times. And literally get mixed service it really depends on the person which is crazy but it's ok I live down the street I like chili's so I tolerate it. I ALWAYS look for one particular person she's a bartender and manager light skinned curly hair she's the absolute best very attentive and accommodating but Sunday night I sat in the bar Tammy was our bartender she was great and alert even when someone tried to skip out on paying ... Lol (highlights)

Never coming here again and if you don't want to have your time wasted for mediocre food don't even bother.
Waitress was very attentive.. But the greeter was horrible. Why was he staring at me when I walked in, never said hello. I had to greet him. I don't care for the food, but I was meeting a friend.

Poor poor service it took the waitress 45 min to ask us wat we wanted to drink she was to busy talking to everyone in the restaurant like if she was at a party and 2 hours to get our food so disappointed with that and even after she brought the food didn't give us forks or napkins ..... I will never go here again
Best fresh food,super nice service,professional people big thanks specially for Sharon really was very nice & helpful
Food was alright but I don't want to wait 15 mind after sitting down for my drinks and appetizers. And then wait over an hour for my food. I don't know how they just ignore you while you are waiting

Absolute worst service possible. Waited at least 40 minutes for our food. I'm still waiting for my water that the waitress was supposed to bring back. Also I had to ask 4 people to change the T.V. that nobody was watching. It finally got changed and before the game was over some worker changed it to sportscenter and then walked away like he was deaf when our table spoke up. This is the first time I ever left a 0.00 tip. If you're in this area steer clear of this establishment.
There is no professionalism here. No respect for the customers, and no structure as far as staff professionalism. Very disappointed.
One hour and 20 minutes to get our food, then they first bring the entrée before the appetizers.  I come from the city of Ontario I will never be back here.
I finally came to try it out and I had a great experience. Even though it was busy, our waitress was checking on us and was very friendly. Food was great! The prices aren't bad at all.

If I could give negative stars I would, my sons family birthday dinner was ruined last night at this poorly run joke of an establishment.  It was my sons 17th birthday and he picked Chilli's and boy was that a mistake.  Every possible thing that could go wrong went wrong.  When we ordered our food and drinks we sat there for over 20 minutes and had to ask 3 times about just receiving our drinks or even just water.  The appetizers finally came out before the drinks and they didn't even bring us plates, napkins or silverware for the appetizers.  Finally half of our drinks came and we still had to ask for the 2 margaritas, coffee for my father in law, and sodas for some of the kids and then just requested if they could bring more waters in the meantime since we had finished the appetizers.  So we finished our appetizers without getting any napkins or silverware or plates.  After asking 2 different servers passing by I decided to go to the restroom and I grabbed the paper towels from the bathroom so we could at least clean our hands.  Finally my father in law got his coffee but we couldn't get sugar or creamer so he drank his coffee black. My sister in law got her margarita but it was nothing like the picture, it didn't have the berries in it, the salted rim or the pineapple wedge, nor was it served in a margarita glass but it was the right color at least, my wife received a margarita but it was a flavored one and not a plain one on the rocks.  When our dinners arrived after about an hour and 15 minutes wait, and mind you, it was not very busy, at all, the server said watch out hot plate coming through with fajitas.  The fajitas were not sizzling and they we're actually cold and you could grab the skillet by the handle, so no sir they actually were cold non sizzling fajitas on a cold plate, so how long were they sitting there? Anyways I was so hungry so I ate them.  My friend sitting next to me didn't even get the fixings for his fajitas so he asked for them but by the time the rice beans and sides came for his fajitas, my friend had eaten everything and had no need for the sides anymore. When all the plates were delivered to the table, my sister in law asked where her food was.  Server asked what she ordered and she said the fish tacos, the server replied oh we don't have fish tacos.  So why didn't he say that at the start of the order.  So of course by the time she got her steak tacos everyone at the table was done with all their food.  My wife asked for limes for her tacos several times and what do you know, those limes were never seen.  My friend and my brother in law asked for refills and they grabbed our glasses and then never came back so I guess no refills.  I actually shared the silverware with my brother in law, because we didn't get enough silverware for everyone. So I shared his fork to make my fajitas tacos and then I would pass the fork back to my brother in law so he could eat his burnt to hell steal that was supposed to come out medium rare. We also needed tortillas for the fajitas and after I myself needed a refill and tortillas, I decided to get up and get them myself since our servers were incapable of simple requests.  I went to the side entrance of kitchen and asked for my tortillas and then received them, then I took a couple of our lemonades to the bar and got the refills there, then retuned back to the table. So we said we were there to celebrate our sons birthday and they never came and did the happy birthday song.  We sent the kids meanwhile to cold stone which was best decision of the night, so while we waited for bull or manager or anyone, the kids had time to go to cold stone and got ice cream and finished it and returned back to chillis and then we waited.  I also had a coupon for free kids meal that was emailed to us and I ordered the cheeseburger sliders for my baby girl and those never came, yet when we got the bill there was all sorts of charges on it that we didn't get, we had 2 margaritas yet they charged us for 3, they charged us for the sliders which we didn't receive which I had a coupon for, the sides for the fajitas which came late, they charged us for a queso dip which we never received, and they charged us for blackberry tea which we didn't receive and table entertainment which we didn't use either, we did look at the table screens to figure out our bill and to discover these horrendous overcharges.  So after not receiving all our food orders, appetizers, drinks and getting cold food and no birthday song and overcharging us on our bill, the manager came back and told us that she took care of the items we didn't receive, so wow we actually got free steak tacos for my sister in law that received her tacos when everyone was done.  WORST EXPERIENCE OF MY LIFE AND SONS BDAY DINNER RUINED!!!!  2 1/2 hours of my life I won't get back, so safe to say I will never go to a chillis ever, and I used to go once every other month and never was treated like this!  Zero stars!
